body:
When adding a new repo helm always appends /index.yaml to the end of URL. This is undesired behaviour for some repositories that need additional query string parameters, such as Azure Blob Storage. Azure Blob Storage required appending special query string to HTTPS URL in order to get access to the file. Other sites might use similar mechanism or want to pass some parameters as query strings.

Example URL:

https://sometestblobstorage.blob.core.windows.net/?sv=2017-04-17&ss=1234&srt=asd&sp=12314&se=2019-10-15T19:49:26Z&st=2017-10-15T11:49:26Z&spr=https&sig=MKARQzLpTeSt7IRlgjpF9ke6p34UO0xhUGaMotWUrz1PpDFWw

Helm looks for index.yaml at:

https://sometestblobstorage.blob.core.windows.net/?sv=2017-04-17&ss=1234&srt=asd&sp=12314&se=2019-10-15T19:49:26Z&st=2017-10-15T11:49:26Z&spr=https&sig=MKARQzLpTeSt7IRlgjpF9ke6p34UO0xhUGaMotWUrz1PpDFWw/index.yaml

Expected behaviour:

inserting index.yaml inside url, right before query string.

https://sometestblobstorage.blob.core.windows.net/index.yaml?sv=2017-04-17&ss=1234&srt=asd&sp=12314&se=2019-10-15T19:49:26Z&st=2017-10-15T11:49:26Z&spr=https&sig=MKARQzLpTeSt7IRlgjpF9ke6p34UO0xhUGaMotWUrz1PpDFWw


I know that probably in the same way we would need to rewrite fetching packages. I am ready to create PR this week.
title: Helm always appends /index.yaml at the end of the URL
